Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of IRB's failure to consider state protection evidence
Outcome: IRB decision quashed, case remanded for redetermination
Credibility_Assessment: Applicants' evidence of threats and corruption deemed credible
Evidence_Type: Threats from political figure, reports to authorities, systemic corruption in police
Legal_Provision: Section 97(1) of IRPA - Convention Refugee definition
Basis_of_Claim: Fear of persecution by non-state actor with state inability to protect
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Widespread corruption and inefficacy of Mexican police forces
Application_Error: Failure to properly apply presumption of state protection in corrupt democracy
Evidence_Ignored: Evidence of systemic corruption and lack of effective state response
Application_Factor: Inability of state to provide protection due to corruption
Decision_Review_Issue: Did IRB unreasonably dismiss the claim?
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Presumption of state protection rebuttable by credible evidence
Cause_of_Refusal: Insufficient proof of lack of state protection
Evidentiary_Issues: IRB failed to adequately assess evidence on state protection
Procedural_Fairness: IRB did not provide adequate reasons for rejecting evidence
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to reasonableness of IRB decision
Procedural_Issue: Failure to consider all relevant evidence
Omission_Type: Failure to consider evidence of corruption and state incapacity
